description.narrative:
This grant will enable the Network of Aquaculture Centres in Asia Pacific (NACA) to organize a writeshop with the goal of producing book chapters for the publication, Successes in Chinese Aquaculture.
About Successes in Chinese Aquaculture The book will cover: -aquaculture policies and strategies -development of indigenous species and high-value fish -fish farming options -public and private sector involvement -future trends in Chinese aquaculture
It will follow the same format of the earlier IDRC Springer co-publication, Success Stories in Asian Aquaculture (2010).
Aquaculture in China China is by far the largest aquaculture producer in the world with a long aquaculture history. Outside of China, knowledge of the Chinese industry is low, particularly among English-speaking audiences.
Successes in Chinese Aquaculture will be written in English; copies will be distributed to organizations practicing aquaculture in Asia. NACA and IDRC will develop a distribution plan.
The publication of this book is part of renewed interest in aquaculture in South Asia and China.
